name: PXI Opcode Palette
description: Machine-readable specification of the Pixel Instruction (PXI) set for pxOS.

opcodes.action: No operation. The Kernel Cursor advances to the next pixel without side effects.

Read a pixel value from the DATA region. The address is specified by the (G, B) channels of the instruction pixel, interpreted as (X, Y) coordinates. The loaded value is stored in a temporary register.
Write a pixel value from a temporary register to the DATA region. The destination address is specified by the (G, B) channels.
Perform a parallel addition (e.g., alpha blend) of two pixel values. The source and destination are specified by operands.
Set the Kernel Cursor to a new location in the PXI Region. The target address is specified by the (G, B) channels.
Compare two pixel values. The result is stored in the FLAGS channel (Alpha) of a status register.
Emit the current contents of the DATA region to the FRAME region, making it visible to the user.
Stop the execution of the current program. The PxOS scheduler will terminate the process.
